cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles south-southwest of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn northwest across eastern-central Cuba Sunday night–Monday, emerge into the Florida Straits, move northward along or just inland of Florida’s west coast Tuesday, then accelerate northeastward up the U.S. Southeast coast and pass near or just offshore of the Mid-Atlantic (NJ/NY) around Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast near the Big Bend/Tampa area

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for the Mid-Atlantic coastline
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for the Mid-Atlantic coastline
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, then the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts from GA through NJ as the storm accelerates northeastward
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Thursday; gusty winds possible as Elsa’s remnant passes offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected along the Delaware River or New Jersey coast from Elsa at this time.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1-3 inches of rain possible Thursday–Thursday night as outer rain bands sweep across the region.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Enhanced rip currents and rough surf along the New Jersey beaches.
